thread.title: Fla. dog lies down for hours at spot where owner was killed
thread.title_full: Fla. dog lies down for hours at spot where owner was killed - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Fla. dog lies down for hours at spot where owner was killed
text:
A woman’s dog was loyal until the very end — and beyond.
After a Florida woman was fatally struck by a vehicle Friday, her dog laid down on the site of the accident for hours, according to WJAX .
Kelly Black, 42, was walking her furry pet, Paco, when she was hit by a big rig truck in Jacksonville, officials said.
The bandana-wearing dog, who was not injured, remained at the scene long after deputies discovered his owner’s body and removed it.
He eventually left when Black’s family arrived to bring him home.
KTLA5 Kelly Black was killed when she was struck and dragged by a semi truck. Her dog, Paco, stayed by the scene of the accident until he was picked up by family members. On Friday morning, the truck-driver was pulling out of a gas station when he allegedly hit Black and dragged her 30 feet, officials added.
Officials believe the driver may not have known he hit someone.
“I don’t see how someone could hit her here and drag her all the way out to Beaver Street and not have known it,” the woman’s father, G.C. Bostick, told the station through tears.
Family members told the station Black, Paco and another dog —Sambo, who was not involved in the accident — were inseparable.
WFOX 30 Paco stayed put for hours after Black’s death, and is ‘not too happy’ according to the victim’s mother, who is familiar with her daughter’s dogs. “(Paco)is not too happy, and Sammy is not either, because she's not there with them right now,” the victim’s mother, Pat Johnson, told the station.
“They are used to me and they're going to be really sad,” she said.
Johnson is now asking for the public’s help in figuring out the tragic incident that took her daughter’s life.
“I wish somebody would call and tell what they’ve seen, what happened and why it happened,” said Johnson. “I would like that very much.”
KTLA5 A truck-driver was pulling out of a gas station when he allegedly hit Black and dragged her 30 feet on Friday, officials added. Johnson remembered her daughter as a big-hearted woman who deeply loved her two pets.
The two women were spending more time together as Black was dedicated to getting closer to her mother in her older years.
“I loved Kelly to my heart ... She wanted to be close to me because I'm getting old,” Johnson told the station.
“She was a loving good person and she loved everybody,” she added.
Deputies are still looking for the truck driver, officials said.
